intro: Valerianella lutea, commonly known as yellow marsh woundwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along stream banks and wet meadows. Valerianella lutea is often found in temperate regions and is known for its aromatic foliage. It plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
